thread.title: Shocking moment man throws young woman to the ground in attempted rape in east London
thread.title_full: Shocking moment man throws young woman to the ground in attempted rape in east London

author: Hatty Collier
title: Shocking moment man throws young woman to the ground in attempted rape in east London
text:
Wenger rubbishes Bellerin to Barcelona claims 
This is the shocking moment a man hurled a woman to the ground during an attempted rape in east London. 
CCTV footage shows the suspect running at the 22-year-old woman from behind and throwing her onto the pavement in Dagenham. 
Scotland Yard said the attacker then removed his jeans and exposed himself to the victim. 
She managed to fight him off by punching him in the stomach and shouting for help. 
The footage shows the suspect fleeing after a car pulls up along the roadside and the driver calls the police. CCTV: Footage showed the moment the young women was thrown to the ground by her attacker (Metropolitan Police) 
Police said the man, described as aged in his 30s with fair hair and a short brown beard, had followed the victim off the EL2 bus, which had stopped on Wood Lane opposite the Morrisonâ€™s supermarket at about 6.20pm on March 6. 
He launched his attack after they had turned the corner into Becontree Avenue and ran off back towards Wood Lane after he was disturbed. 
Detectives investigating the attempted rape have released the CCTV footage in an appeal for witnesses to come forward. Appeal: Police want to speak to this man in connection with the assault (Metropolitan Police) 
They have also shared an image of a man travelling on the bus before the attack in a bid to identify him. He wore blue jeans, a grey top and a white t-shirt. 
Detective Constable Matt James, from the Sexual Offences, Exploitation and Child Abuse Command, said: "The woman is very shaken from her ordeal. She was able to shout for help and use self-defence to flee from her attacker. 
"We are keen to identify the man in the CCTV footage so we can speak to him about the incident. 
"We would also urge anyone who witnessed the incident to contact us." 
There have been no arrests and enquiries continue. 
Anyone with information is asked to call police on 101 or by tweeting at @MetCC or to give information anonymously contact Crimestoppers on 0800 555 111 or visit crimestoppers-uk.org. More about:
